result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Petty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew D. Petty is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew D. Petty was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete Alcohol Assessment & Driver Safety Plan as ordered in 21TR1370 and follow through with recommendations.  Participate in any other assessments as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and follow through with recommended counseling, treatment or programming.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D. Petty

records.addlTxt:
11:23 AM Case called - appearances stated.  (3 TR cases riding along)
Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Matthew D. Petty.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Richards  is heard on def's non-appearance. Unable to reach def. by phone
State requests a warrant and def. be held for further hearing

Court authorizes a warrant, Def. to be held for further hearing.

State does not object to the three (3) TR cases continuing to track along with criminal case and not be defaulted today.

*****************************************

11:33 AM   case recalled - same appearances as before for counsel, and Defendant appears at this time

Court recalls warrant previously authorized

Atty Richards is heard -Upon a plea of guilty by def on ct. 1, State will be moving to dismiss ct. 2, recommending withheld sentence, 1 year probation
State agrees with recitation of agreement by Atty. Richards.
State agrees to dismiss refusal and improper parking upon a plea to the Oper. w/RCS

Def. is unsure/confers with his attorney

Questions by Court - response def. 

as to: 21TR1370 - Def. enters plea of GUILTY - Court accepts def's plea and finds Def. GUILTY
State moves to dismiss 22TR69 (refusal) and 21TR1369 (improper parking)
Court dismisses 22TR69 and 21TR1369 - 
State requests guideline penalties and blood draw of $120.00 (Crossing Rivers)

Court orders on 21TR1370 $250. forf. plus costs +120 blood draw  ($1057.50) 6 mo. DL rev. Alc. Assess/DSP, No IID ordered - 60 DTP 

As to 22CF02 - 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea. Court accepts the defendants plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 
Def. enters a plea of GUILTY to ct. 1 - Court accepts def's plea and finds def. GUILTY of ct. 1
State moves to dismiss ct.2 - Ct. 2 dismissed by Court

Atty. Steiner is heard on sentence - recommends court withhold sentence, 1 year probation with conditions deemed appropriate by the DOC
Atty. Richards is heard on sentence - requests court approve agreement and withhold sentence and place def. on1 yr. probation, 1 day jail credit
Def. is heard on sentence

Court puts findings on the record and sentences defendant as follows: 
Sentence withheld, 1 yr  probation. Complete AODA assessment as ordered in 21TR1370 and follow through with recommendations.  Participate in any other assessments as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and follow through with recommended counseling, treatment or programming. Court costs of $518.00 - can request payment plan for this and the forfeiture case ($1057.50 plus $518) 1575.50 60 DTP
$200.00 bond to be applied

1 day jail credit

9:13 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew D. Petty appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew D. Petty.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard on the status of the cases, they have reached an agreement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 11:15 am.

2:03 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew D. Petty appeared by video, Attorney Steven G. Richards for Matthew D. Petty appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and will bind over for further proceedings. 

Clerk will enter not guilty pleas into the record as to each traffic matter. 

Court makes note that 22TR69 and 22TR1370 are op w/res cont sub on the same date.  22TR69 looks to be a refusal as there is no citation that goes along with it.  

Clerk will enter not guilty pleas as to each of the two counts in case 22CF02
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:56 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew D. Petty appeared by video, Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew D. Petty, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Atty. Steven Richards apptd.

1:41 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew D. Petty appeared by phone, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Also - 2021TR001369, 2021TR001370, 2022TR000069

Def comments on retaining an attorney. 
Court advises right to an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew D. Petty
Current: E4578 380th Ave., Lot 23, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States  (Effective: 01-07-2022)
Prior: 923 Hastings Way P.O. Box 226, Eau Claire, WI 54701
Adjourned initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:05 PM Defendant Matthew D. Petty appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
  Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
    Def. states working on an atty.  D.A. requests no change in bond; $250.00 has been posted.
    Court does not change the bond--leave at the $250.00 posted, Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 
    Court concludes at 3:14 p.m.  Adj. Initial Appearance set for February 14, 2022, at 1:30 p.m.
$200 posted by Roger Petty through Chippewa County

10:38 AM Defendant Matthew D. Petty not in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court notes Mr. Petty does not appear today; was aware of today's date.  Court authorizes a warrant.  D.A. requests $200 bond amount.  Court approves request.
     Court concludes at 10:39 a.m. 
(NOTE:  Initial Appearance not held, as he did not show; criminal complaint not provided--was a regular Hearing.)  nad
